Description: Frame containing approximately 37 fragments of codex pages with Coptic script in black, in a literary hand. The fragments are unattached to the glass, but the frame is sealed with brown paper tape.
Curator's comments: Two fragments have the same writing as on EA76566.

Previously unregistered material located on the counter in the papyrus store until 2000. Provenance unrecorded. On a slip of paper is written 'No. 279' and on a label '279 Page 9' which refers to the acquisition of group EA76565-76576.
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, loose Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: Kraft paper (loose, torn) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
Acquisition notes: In the acquisition documents we can find 13 fragments (EA76415, 76565-76576) donated by Rutter and Marchant sollicitors to the Museum in 1935. They were part of the collection of John Lee, Hartwell Museum. Another group of Coptic text (EA79673-79708) and 7 Shenoute texts were also acquired the same time from the same collection.
